location: 42 หมู่ 3 ต บุ่ง, บุ่ง, เมือง, อำนาจเจริญ 37000, Thailand
comments: Terrible food never go again
Ho ho
ดอกไม้สวยมากคะ
ห้องพักแย่ อาหารห่วย พนักงานหน้ามึน

name: キトウシキャンプ場 無料
location: Konbumorimura, Kushiro, Kushiro District, Hokkaido 085-2273, Japan
comments: 崖下で砕け散る波音しか聞こえない、大変ワイルドなキャンプ場です。霧の深い日や雨の日にはテントの中でのんびりするのも骨休みになるかもしれません。いつまでもあって欲しい野営場の一つです。

name: Nakashibetsucho Midorigaoka Forest Park
location: Japan, 〒086-1145 Hokkaidō, Nakashibetsu-chō, 北海道標津郡中標津町北中３－１６
comments: 8月下旬にバイクサイトを利用。鬱蒼とした林間で藪蚊が多いので夏は特に虫対策必須。また、バイクサイト内は木の根が結構あるので雨天時はスリップ注意です。場内にはエゾリスとシマリスが走り回っています。
很棒的公園，有各種活動設施，適合帶小朋友來玩。
手入れのされたキャンプ場。テントは一張り２１６円からで多目的トイレ、炊事場、コインシャワーは１００円
バイクのキャンプサイトはぬかるみが多く、ヤブ蚊の集団がものすごいことになっている。また、スズメバチの巣もあちこちにありかなり怖い思いをした。

有料（テント7人以下持ち込みの場合216円）管理人夕方まで常駐

トイレ   水道あり

温泉   コンビニ    スーパー近い

ゲートからは車（バイク、自転車以外）での荷物の運搬以外での進入は出来ない。

バイク専用サイトがあり、サイト内にバイク進入可能

サイドスタンドが沈み込まないようにする為の板が置いてある

バイク専用サイトは芝生面がほとんど無く、雑草面なサイト。

name: Tawadaira Camping Ground
comments: Nice field, but very windy place at the top of a hill (not the best place for a camp ground). The dirt road to the top was nice. Food is very basic.

晴れた日の景観は最高！
360度パノラマで芝生も綺麗でした

ただ、キャンプされる方は
斜面しかない
寝心地わるいのは覚悟
夜は8月でも寒いので、それなりの装備で。

レストラン１９時まで
近いコンビニでも10キロ
スタンドは30分くらい走った
温泉30分くらい
自販機はあり

飲食は準備して来た方が良いと思います。

とても景色が素晴らしい。パノラマ。
晴れていたら、夜も星がよく見えそう。
ぜひ、キャンプをしてみたい。
ただ、残念だったのは、障害者?人のバイクをボコボコ蹴る人がいて不愉快だった。
360度、どこまでも地平線。キャンプサイトはふかふかの芝生。北海道へ上陸するたびに必ず訪れる場所のひとつです。レストハウスの食事もとても美味です。

２日利用しました。
曇り空で星空を観れないと諦めて寝て
夜中2:00頃に目が覚めて外に出たら、雲が一つも無い満天の星空になっており感動しました。

name: ＭＯ−ＴＴＯかぜて
location: Japan, 〒088-1485 Hokkaidō, Akkeshi-gun, Hamanaka-chō, 浜中町浜中東６線６６
comments:
自転車で夜にやってきたが、閉鎖していた。
更に13キロ走って別のキャンプ場に行くハメに。
2009年7月26日 自転車で旅行中に立ち寄り。キャンプ場やアスレチックが楽しめる公園みたいです。「かぜて」は北海道弁で「仲間に入れる」の意味から来ているそうです。「MO-TTO」は牛の鳴き声の「モー」と「もっとがんばろう！」の意が込められているそうです。
トイレが綺麗だし、サイト内も管理されているので気持ち良く利用できた。買い出しや入浴が遠く不便であるが、空いているので混まないキャンプ場が好きな人にはおすすめできる。空いてるとバイクはサイト脇に停めさせてくれました。
静かで、環境も良く落ち着けるキャンプ場です。しかし6月のシーズンになるとブユとか蚊とかが沢山居て、対策をかなりシッカリしないと大変ですね。
とにかくキレイ！　サイトは芝が良く手入れされていて、しかも平らなので、テントをはる位置で悩まなくても良い。トイレも掃除が行き届いていて、やっぱり綺麗です。ただ林間ではないので、見晴らしが良すぎて……総合的にはかなり快適な方でした。また泊まりたいな。

name: Toromotomura Camping Ground
location: Japan, 〒088-2263 Hokkaidō, Kawakami-gun, 北海道川上郡標茶町塘路原野北８線１６９
comments: Nice camp site on the lake. Not many people there. I think you were supposed to pay, but we couldn't find any signs in English. But the locals were lovely, we somehow talked to an old man at the station who gave us a ride to the camp site, we thought we were being kidnapped, but it was just a nice gesture. The Italian place on the highway is pretty much the only place to get a meal, so come prepared with food.
有料370円。照明不備。蚊多し。バイク乗り入れ不可。茅沼温泉10km。農協25km。炊事場の照明が故障中で有料の価値なし。

車の乗り入れは不可だが、荷物搬入の際はサイト脇の道路に路駐できるので
それほど苦にならない。
綺麗に整備されていました。

釧路湿原の中に有るキャンプ場。
近くにオートキャンプ場が有るのでここは人も少なく穴場です。
食材の買い出しは事前に。

name: اکو کمپ روستای متین اباد
comments: اکوکمپ کویری متین آباد در شمال شهرستان نطنز قرار دارد.

name: Matinabad Desert Camp
comments: A Highlight of our Iran Trip, very calm in the offseason, but you still can enjoy camel riding and especially star watching. Tents are quite comfortable with air condition and sleeping bags. Just one negative point: no one speaks english during our stay.
The Camp is great. If you sleep in a tent, safe your food because of the animals
This is a great eco-camp in the middle of desert
Nice and different place to stay in the middle of the desert.
it was a cool place for relaxation

name: "Medved'"
location: Ulitsa Zalesnaya, 2, Kansk, Krasnoyarskiy kray, Russia, 663604
comments:
Взяли на одну ночь недорогой номер с удобствами на этаже (3 этаж). На этаже три довольно приличных и чистых санузла (два - с душем), очереди не было))). 
Окна выходили на трассу - довольно шумно при открытом окне. А с закрытым - душно, так как нет кондиционера. 
В здании находится кафе и круглосуточный магазин.
В цену входит завтрак на выбор: яичница или рисовая каша с блином, чай пакетиковый или кофе растворимый.
Есть охраняемая стоянка - 50 руб. за авто.
Останавливаемся там уже два раза,  не разочаровались - всё соответствует заплаченым деньгам.

Комплекс неплохой, есть мойка, стоянка для грузовых, магазин круглосуточный, шиномонтаж , СТО, вот только персонал не приветливый. Нам тут не рады! Про СТО вообще отдельная история, вроде вывеска "ремон любой сложности" а по факту делают только то что и сам могу. Как то так.
2200р за номер с 2мя одноместными кроватями и санузлом. и бесплатным завтраком. в столовой еда понравилась. вкусный компот. и самое главное нам пустили с собакой. рекомендую.

Позвонила в гостиницу  ,  взяла  трубку женщина .
      Поинтересовавюшись есть ли  2 -х местные места и можно ли с маленкой  собачкой ,   администратор ответила что можно за 2200 душ,  санузел., холодильник  да еще  дают талон на завтрак .
   Для путешественников  самый отличный вариант
Сантехника старая, бельё черное + красное (Как то светлые тона привычнее),  в номере запах курева, в стене дырка.... А так нормально

name: Aygul'
comments: Очень вкусные блинчики)))

name: Turolandiya
location: Pushkina St, 67, Cherkasy, Cherkas'ka oblast, Ukraine, 18000

name: clear field
comments: Новый вид отдыха. 2 км по щебню и мы приехали в эко поселение. Мы хотели зайти в кафе. Было вкусно и красиво. Тишина вместе с простором дает глубокий отдых на уровне клеток.  Есть пруд с отделом для детей. Все чисто уходенно.  Если устал и хочешь освежиться , то тебе сюда.  Мы живем рядом в городе Кашира и с радостью посетили это новое творческое объединение. Рекомендую с детьми.  И просто кто хочет уединения.
Отличное место для проведения праздников и тихого отдыха. Территория большая, есть на что посмотреть, где уединиться, поиграть с детьми. Есть животные

+ тихо, 400 га земли, достаточно вкусная еда, есть зал для медитации, хорошая спорт площадка для детей и взрослых, можно покататься на лошадях, если походите по территории с Дмитрием - можно влюбиться в это место
- это не 120 км от москвы, а ок 160, часть пути по разбитой проселочной дороге, по территории земляные дорожки, новые построенные домики - с маленькими ванными, часть номеров вообще без них, слышимость удивительная,в комнате может стоять диван и тд (кофморт = 2 из 5) и да, девушка Екатерина  нам, приехавшим почти в 11 вечера после долгой дороги из Москвы была совсем не рада и гостепреимство было на 0.
Очень интересное место для здорового отдыха и отдыха с детьми. Есть обучение верховой езде.
Идеально для отдыха небольшой компанией или семьёй

name: Купава Каневская
location: ул. Софиевская, 5 , с. Лепляво, Каневский р-н, Cherkas'ka oblast, Ukraine, 19020
comments: Cool place for the rest after a city. They do have woods and grills, cute houses as well with a warm, even hot water.

Добираться крайне неудобно, с Канева только на такси. Деньги закидываешь на счет непончтному дяденьке заранее （хотя обошлось без развода）Встречают тебя без особого радушия. Коттедж эт очеееень громкое название, по факту кормушка для двух воробьев, удобств особых нет. Грязно, убогая уборная, холодильника, фена, утюга и т.д нет. Сервис на огромном минусе, никто не то что не напрягается, а еще и ведет себя по хамски. Пляж крайне неухожен, очень и очень мелко, все в водорослях, плохо пахнет, плавает дохлая рыба. Территория огромная, но крайне неухожена. Отдых ровно на единицу, непонятно за что с тебя дерут такие огромные деньги. Настоятельно не рекомендую！

Из плюсов: домики для отдыха, альтанки, сосны, свежий воздух, кафе, где можно купить водички и мороженое, гамачок, красивые закаты. Минусы: заброшенная советская база, мелкий пляж, под берегом везде тина. Взрослым купаться невозможно. Вода зелено-желтая. Территория огромная, но не ухоженная (не кошено и не подметалось). Жуткие комары после захода солнца. Пожарить шашлык и полюбоваться закатом подойдет!

Ездили группой на выходные. Отдохнули хорошо, но само место мне не понравилось.
Минусы: нет холодильника (можно взять аренду ячейку в общем холодильнике), тумбочки, стола, фена, кондиционера. Вода из крана ужасно пахнет, очень маленькие комнаты, территория неухоженная, для такого сервиса цены явно завышены. 

Из плюсов: хороший Вай-фай, свежий воздух.

Были в данном месте дважды.
Очень крутая территория, есть еще над чем работать.
Хозяин очень радушный, но не идеален, т.к. праздновали ДР мужа. заказа ли при первом визите меню , баню и чан. По факту не было готово ничего т.е обо всем приходилось переживать.
Не советую для празднования каких либо событий,но советую просто для семейного, романтического  отдыха .

ЗАКАТЫ УМОПОМРАЧИТЕЛЬНО  ПРЕКРАСНЫ!
Никогда не думала что закаты над рекой могут посоревноваться с  морскими ,но это так.

name: Camping Stomio
comments: Nice camp with very fair prices. The toilets are clean and the beach is near by. Some improvement in the infrastructure could be improved but for those prices you won't find a better place.
Τεράστιοι χώροι , καθαρές τουαλέτες και δίπλα στη θάλασσα
Velice příjemný a levný kemp

name: Campsite Vrachos Kastraki
comments: Camping correct. Propre et prix imbattable. Les bungalow sont en fait des caravanes. Mais on dort très bien.

name: Camping Mytikas
comments: The only negative thing is the fact that this camp is 200-300 m from the beach. It is clean, hot watter all day, on every two caravans there are place for dish washing.   There is pool and market. It is not very big camp, but is quite organized. Price is very good...

For the price of 15 euro (2 people with a tent) we got: a small pitch, lack of hot water in the shower, washbasins and sinks GREEN with dirt and local lichen, extra-paid electricity, extra-paid wifi, an unpleasant host, dirt everywhere, murky water in the swimming pool, muddy water covering the floor of the bathroom, big spiders in the toilets (it might be really frightening for a person who is afraid of them) and no toilet paper in all the toilets. It all yells to us: I'm a filthy and unpleasant place, stay away from me! 
The place needs general cleaning and renovation. 
The host does not require her guests to keep quiet at night. There are kids running free and loudly till midnight and dogs barking at 4 in the morning.
The money we paid is way too much for all of this.
We wanted to stay longer cause the beach near the camp is beautiful but we just couldn't stand the conditions provided by the camp...
We wish all the best to the host in her inevitable process of renovating the site. The area is beautiful and calm and worth being taken care of.
Daleč od morja. Veliko ljudi in mali prostori za kampiranje. Masovni turizem. Z ženo sva se po ogledu odpeljala dalje proti jugu.
Όμορφο το μέρος

name: Camping Arion
comments: Wonderful shade, throughout the day, adequate installations, courteous and helpful staff. Strong laid back feeling of camaraderie. Great for caravans and families.
3,5. Near beach,  little bit old style, clean, friendly staff.
Nice and quiet very cheap also
Excellent place with nice atmosphere.

Családias,nagyon kedvesek.Jó helyen van,közel a tengerpart,árnyas.Vannak a közelben éttermek,közértek,pékbolt,ajándékboltok,húsbolt.Tomas a recepción mindig ajánlott jó kiránduló programot.Nagyon jól éreztük magunkat!!

name: Camping Evridiki
comments: To noisy for holiday for my taste, haotic, caravan put without any order, crowd, dusty and to many cars inside the camp...
Great beach
Feelings that money can not buy...
to many people. also and cars.
too crowded

name: Deer Lake RV Park & Campgrounds
location: 197 Nicholsville Rd, Deer Lake, NL A8A 2C9, Canada
comments: We have travelled across Canada and stayed at lots of campgrounds in both National and Provincial Parks and privately run Establishments. Deer Lake was unfortunately not the best. We were down by the lake which was a 10 minute return trip to the only washroom facility on site so we just went straight to bed on arrival and then drove to the showers on our way out in the morning. What facilities they did have on site were meadocre at best, only one shower and no natural light in the washroom meaning it was really dark. Also, you could only get wifi at the office! $25 is too much for what you get.
Great place!! Friendly staff, great sites , beautiful view and great price!! Love this place

Arrived to find that they had forgotten our reservations which wasn't a big deal by itself, but there were other issues with this place. The sites we ended up getting had no RV hookups and the ground wasn't very flat for our RVs. There don't seem to be any quiet hours as the campers 2 sites over were blasting loud music and yelling until 2:35am. Asking for them to turn it down around 1:30am did nothing. The washrooms are dumpy and you can see missing paint on the walls where urinals used to be. Overall I would not recommend anyone stay here.

name: Gateway to the North RV Park
location: #1 Bonne Bay Road, Deer Lake, NL A8A 2V1, Canada
comments: sites were level, operators seem very nice. Had to find them office was closed period, open but not opened for business, lots not maintained, self check in, pick your own site, no info given. wash rooms toilets not cleaned for 2 days we stayed, out of paper towel for 2 days, toilets dirty for 2 days, good location for Viking trail but right on highway, lots of noise
Beautiful place and right on the deer lake beach. Love it
The person who as it is really nice to get along with and it is close to everything

Conveniently located on highway to Northern  Peninsula and Gros Morne Park, this park is an easy choice. All the amenities you expect.  My only problem was being too close to that busy highway and traffic noise. Price is also inline with its perfect location.

Snooty and unhelpful registration person.  Park is more like parking at Walmart but on gravel.  Some showers don't work and even at that it is one change room for two showers.  Washroom facilities unseated.  This was also the most expensive campground we found while in Newfoundland and this is towards the end of our trip.  I do not recommend this campground to anyone.

name: Zenzville RV Campground
location: 446 Kippens Rd, Kippens, NL A2N 1B6, Canada
comments: Nice place. Wooded and open sites. Advertised 30ft water slide is broken... Something they do not tell you until you have paid them $4 per swimmer. "Convenience store" is really a Canteen near empty. Ice cream very good and cheap.
Nice place, affordable, cabins where basic but in great condition had some electricity so you can charge up your phone or tablet, had a fire pit at each site.
Stay here at least a few days every fall. Love the cabins and the 'roughing it's.
Amazing park no matter how you want to stay, they have campsites, rv sites and cabin rentals. Pool facility, canteen, wifi, and more.
Advertise on their site they have tent site but not anymore. They were at least helpful and allowed me to take a shower.

name: Camping Jardín De Venus
location: Avenida 5, 1239, Mario Villanueva Madrid, 77930 Bacalar, Q.R., Mexico
comments: Great staff, awesome water with a small nice beach and a dock. Really beautiful and a good place to have a great time at.
Flys in kitchen  dog's barking
Lovely romantic place!
Great spot
Dormir en el camper, es super incómodo!

name: Kumbh Camps
location: Parade Ground, Daraganj, Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh 211005, India
comments: It's like play ground good place.
Good place to see a Temporary City for a Month with religious value
Car driving learning place
Nice place for doing yoga in morning..
It's beautiful and large place

name: Tanda Tula Safari Camp
location: Timbavati Private Game Reserve, Kruger Park, South Africa
comments:
Fabulous place. Stayed in a tented room. Had to keep the zippered insect net closed to keep the monkeys out.
Staff make you feel like family. The BEST!
Guide was Luke street. Delightful man and very keen to please. Gave great suggestions for good photos. Would DEFINITELY go there again.

Amazing! It was a dream come true vacation! We were greeted with a welcome drink and cold towel. The grounds are beautiful and the entire staff were extremely helpful and kind. The Chef, Ryan cooks up a delicious feast and is so passionate about cooking and goes out of his way to make sure you are happy. Our tent was absolutely Beautiful! Our bed so comfy and double sinks in the bathroom. Outdoor shower! Everything was perfect. Our Guide/Ranger was Brian and he was Fantastic! We saw the big 5 by the second day and also Wild dogs.Plus, an evening of Star Gazing!  Our tracker was Steven and he was also wonderful! They made a great team. The swimming pool is 5 stars and it over looks a water hole where you can swim and relax while watching Elephants, leopards and many other beautiful animals near by. Tanda Tula deserves many more stars than 5! We highly recommend staying at Tanda Tula! We will be returning!
Great staff,  wonderful guides,  wonderful hospitality.  Excellent food!   Saw lots of animals and learned a lot about Africa and her natural world.
Great service and game viewing.
Nice relaxing bush holiday

name: nDzuti Safari Camp
location: Klaserie Game Reserve, Timbavati Road, Klaserie Private Nature Reserve, 1380, South Africa
comments: Very nice place with big trees and green gras...
Great place in the bush!

Äußerst angenehme Gastgeber, tolles Haus mit schönen Zimmern mit insgesamt maximal 8 Gästen. Schöne, informative Pirschfahrten, gutes Essen und dazu im Vergleich sehr preiswert. Kein single supplement, Ich war schon 2 mal da
idyllisch und mit Seele. .. grandiose Natur!

name: Tamboti Tented Camp
comments: My absolute favourite camp. It has been set out well and is well spaced from other tents. Very quiet camp.
One of my favourite places in the Kruger. All tents have a view of the Tamboti river. If you don't take a tent with a bathroom, be prepared for a walk. Take bug spray!
If you like it rough and camping this is for you
Great accommodation,  wish I  could buy one

Lovely to be back! Super surprised they replaced all the tents with brand new ones as maintenance was needed.
Clever animal proof cages for food storage.

But be aware of the baboons as they are just waiting for an opportunity.

Keep up the great work in the camp!!

name: Maroela Camp
location: Kruger National Park, Satara Road, 1350, South Africa
comments: Very nice tustic camp site. Lots of game in the area. Great camp caretaker. Good ablurions.
Rustic Camp for the more adventurous. Spent a month in this camp. Look out for the honey badgers at night.
One of the best campus in the park! We love it's small cozy atmosphere

Camping and caravans only. Shared kitchen facilities and ablutions. No shops etc. A true bush experience. Need to have all food with you. Nearest shop at Orpen camp, 1 km away. Only accessible during camp opening hours.
Small and peaceful. Very nice... You have to check-in at Orpen Camp before coming here.

name: Limpopo Luxury
location: Pygmy Falcon Dr 22, Raptors view, Hoedspruit, 1380, South Africa
comments: In februari ruim drie weken in Mahlangeni Safari Lodge geweest. Een bijzondere ervaring en een top locatie, vlakbij het Kruger National Park. Het huis is van alle gemakken voorzien en staat op een mooie plek, midden in de natuur. Het lodge management is goed geregeld en het huis wordt erg goed onderhouden. Het heeft een geweldig uitzicht over een meertje, waar regelmatig giraffen, impala's e.d. komen drinken. Aanrader!

name: Fowler RV Park
location: 501 E Cranston Ave, Fowler, CO 81039, USA
comments: Family oriented, friendly Christian R.V Park owned by wonderful people! Fowler R.V park offers the most affordable pricing within 100 miles! My two sons, ages 6 years and 1 year,  loved playing at the playground/park on-site! Hot showers and laundry facility was also available! Perfect for camping and/or extended stays!
Only laundry mat in town with big machines.
Very crowded

We have been there for 6 months & have had a great time. The owners are very personable and do all they can to make your stay pleasant. The night manager is the greatest, he will help with anything you need. It is pet friendly, and there were a few that didn't pick up after their pets but they are no longer there. They have mail service, and if you get mail they (mgmt) will bring to you if you forget to check the box. There is a few mail boxes that everyone's mail gets put into, so you have to look for yours.  I get package delivery also with no problem. Very nice place to stay. Also has a washateria. Resturants near by.
Low prices, friendly locals.

name: Pueblo West Campground & Arena
location: 480 E McCulloch Blvd, Pueblo West, CO 81007, USA
comments: don't go there unless your RV is brand new if it is prior to 2002 you are considered trailer trash and they do not want you there. Needless to say I am taking my business elsewhere.  They can shove it. When I called to inquire they were rude and snotty  on the phone and made me feel like I am less worthy because I have an older RV.
Inexpensive camping (tent) place to keep your horse if you have one. Friendly staff. Only downfall is if you are tent camping you can only camp for 3 days out of a 30 day period.

It was a quiet older resident camp gtound...
Would try it again..

This is a white trash trailer park called a campground but they go by hotel and Innkeeper laws which allows them to throw you out within 30 minutes.
The shower facility is not up to code unsafe and definitely not handicap accessible.
The Pavilion for parties is non-functional with no picnic tables.
The playground is unsafe for children of all ages.
The animals in the arena part itself are mistreated.
They spread horse manure all over the grounds causing an excessive amount of flies which makes this place inhabitable for any outside activities.
 The cabin area is loaded with drunks, drug addicts, and extremely Shady characters from all parts of the country.
The owner has no business ethic whatsoever so don't expect to be treated properly like a business should. However if the owners dogs bite you you can get free rent which they do roam freely.
I assure you these are not lies and I have excessive amount of evidence to prove these allegations.
I'm extremely hopeful that my experience with these people will soon be shutting them down permanently.

This place doesn't allow ssi or people who recieve benefits which is sad. What puzzles me is if you have to have a job then what do RV people do from out of town? Do they have a job in town too? Very confusing place.

name: Camping area (Ranch Koiimasis)

comments: Niesamowite miejsce z absolutnie urzekającym klimatem.

name: Little Hunter's Rest Camping area (Namtib Lodge)
location: Farm Namtib, No. L5, Lüderitz District, Karas Region, Namibia, Namibia
comments: Mitten im nirgendwo. Absolut genial!

name: Leopard Trails
location: Wilpattu Sanctuary Rd, Pahala Maragahawewa, Sri Lanka
comments: Fantastic experience, safari and dinner under the stars, guides and service is fantastic

name: Wilpattu Safari Camp
location: C/O Wimal Stores, Hunuwilagamuwa, Wilpattu Road, Horuwila 20850, Sri Lanka
comments: The owners do a great job. Western style standards and service. Highly recommended.
Namal is a great host n a passionate environmentalist. Staff are attentive and the food is great.

name: Kite House Cafe and Restaurant
location: KITE HOUSE, Odai Karai Road, Kappalady, Kappalady, Kalpitiya 61344, Sri Lanka
comments:
For the discerning outdoor experiential traveller, this is high up on my list of accommodations to check out. 

Experience was well worth my trip from Colombo. Great hosts and friendly staff. Overall simple but nicely designed space, which shows how much love can be put into the making of a place. 

The food is excellent, and Kitehouse Cafe is worth visiting for the food alone. 

Situated in a sort of larger area considered quite sacred, it would be worth spending a few days here at a minimum as it really is a rather magical place.

I'm inspired to go back just thinking about it.

A friend and I turned up here after a long stint of busy travelling and couldn't have felt more welcomed and at home from the very start ( We turned up pretty late but Anais was still waiting for us :) )! The food was just perfect and reasonably priced and everyone would go out of their way to help us. We even returned back here a few weeks later as we couldn't stay away! Surrounded by beautiful scenery, interesting history and a lovely neighbourhood it couldn't have been more what we needed. Thank you so much guys :)

The best food and ambiance in all of Kalpitya by far. You will feel welcomed as if you are a friend rather than a customer and the food is to die for! The pizzas are amazing, the salads unique and fresh, and the milkshakes are delicious (carrot cake is my favorite!). A lot of love goes into the cooking and into Kite House overall. My only regret is not having enough time nor space in my belly to sample the entire menu! Every time I tried a new dish, it became my new favorite. A few of which include: Caprese pizza, easy breezy salad, funky monkey milkshake, carrot cake milkshake and brownie!

Super place ♡ 
Nice vibe and nice people! Defenitly the best spot to chill and refull after your kiting session.

I would call it a truly amazing and relaxing experience! Having stayed for 4 days in between a blue lagoon and a palm forest and being accompanied by the most welcoming Anais and Keira, my partner and I feel that it was once-in-a-lifetime trip in the magical island of Sri Lanka. Hope to make it a twice-in-a-lifetime in a few years! :)

name: Wilpattu Safari Holidays
location: No.199, Wilpattu Road, Horuwila, Sri Lanka
comments:
What a wonderful stay we had at the Wilpattu safari holidays. We were warmly welcomed by the camp manager. The safari was excellent as the naturalist was incredibly well informed and amazing at spotting wildlife. We saw 2 leopards, elephants and a sloth bear. It was great fun! We enjoyed a really delicious lunch with various dishes.
The tents are well laid out. All staff looked after us very well. Thank you.
I spent 2 days in this amazing safari camp site. It surpassed all my expectations. The staff were very welcoming, knowledgeable, accommodation, friendly etc. I cannot rate them highly enough. The tents were immaculate, I felt like I was in a very special 5* hotel. It was a unique feeling to be camping in such luxury. Guides for our safaris were knowledgeable and helpful.
The food was incredible, such a variety at every meal and suited to all tastes both Asian and Western. 
Overall I had a wonderful time and would strongly recommend Wilpattu Safari Holidays to anyone looking for a luxury and authentic safari experience!
It was amazing camping experience

name: Rancho los Fresnos
location: Libramiento Nte, Piedras Negras, Coah., Mexico

name: Rancho Tio Tacho
comments: Buen lugar para paseo con un buen río y paisajes!!
Lo major de Coahuila
Bonito lugar

name: Timberlake Resort & RV Club
location: 4370 N Ridge Rd, Mears, MI 49436, USA
comments: I was visiting my mother who was in from out of town, FOR THE DAY. I was not planning to stay the night, and upon arrival, my girlfriend and I were immediately and very rudely escorted off the premises simply because we arrived a day later than the original party. Their explanation was that guests must travel in the same vehicle as the renting party. However, I was not a guest I was a member of the family. As ludicrous as the rule is, There needs to be more definition as to what constitutes a guest versus a family member. The customer service was incredibly poor and I have no intention of ever returning to this resort. I hope others that read this will do the same. As someone has who has worked in the hospitality industry for more than five years, here's a professional tip: being verbally abusive towards your guests when trying to enforce a policy is not a good business practice and will yield negative results.

Hands down the WORST customer service I have ever experienced. The Staff has no idea what common manners are. I will never again give this campground my business. I would rather camp LITERALLY anywhere. Disgusted with how me and my family were treated.

This is the most unfriendly place for family! Their park rules do not allow family visitors. Everyone must enter the park in the same vehicle at the same time or they will be kicked out. The woman that runs the place is the rudest unfriendly person that I have ever met. I don't know how they stay in business. Never plan on having a group together there. You will have to be looking for an alternative place right in the middle of your vacation!  this pl e totally wrecked our family vacation!!! Your nuts if you ever buy into this resort. You will just be selling it off! Karma will get this back at this place. They are shooting themselves in the foot. The resort wasn't even booked in the middle of summer, that tells you right there, something is very wrong at Timber Lake Resorts!!

BEWARE COST TO COST MEMBERS !!!
This park manager is rude and dose not like members . This was the second thing she told me after telling me when I showed up 1st thing was that I almost did make it in the park mind you made reservations well over a month in advance . It was because  I came in at 6:30 and the office closes at 7:00 . Then she goes on to ask me If I even read the rules of the park before I came up because we as in cost to cost members never read the rules and she should drop cost to cost and that she had to kick out members last . So at this point I should have known not to stay. But we did got check in and let them know that my feonsay and the rest of the kids would up tomorrow . Had help to my site really nice people nice site and grounds . 
Next day the rest of my family shows up around 1:00 pm . Different lady's in charge to check us in . Turns out I have to many people in part and yes I mist that in the rules . I have 8 rules say 4 ..but I had 2 with me when I showed up day before and told the lady Feonsay and kids where coming tomorrow. Well this other lady let them so we get in and every one gets settled over a nice night around the fire as a family go to bed . Get up in the morning go out side and start getting ready for the day the 1st lady comes flying in on a golf cart with a nother guy . Telling me we have a problem here we have broken a "rule" . She has a paper in her hand with the rules on and the cost to cost book showing where you are only allowed 4 people which at point of course we know the lady the day before told us but let us stay .so she goes being rude about . Keep in Mind I've payed them and cost for the week ." 4 people have to go immediately and how soon can I make this happen"I proceeded to tell her as soon as I round them all up and that was the end of the conversation. So I got ever one togeather and we packed the entire camp site and hook the camper and left not one person said a word to us about . So sorry for the long review but I feel that cost to cost members and anyone looking at staying here should know that the park is nice and the people who work ther . but who ever runs that place I feel 
"DOSE NOT WANT OUT SIDERS IN HER PARK"

Hard for a cost to cost members being this the only park in the area for them but anyone just looking for a place to stay there many and a lot nicer parks in the area to go to ..
Beautiful location, roomy sites, fun campers.  If only  the manager could learn some people skills.

name: Picos De La Colina

Ich finde ihn schön, wenn man seine Ruhe haben möchte.

comments: We've been coming here for years and love it. The couple who run it are absolutely charming.
Great location. Very nice receptionist.
Suoer friendly host and clean camping!
Real nice campsite. Not as expensive as other campings. 2 km from the beach. Nice pool.
Camping sympa avec un bon rapport qualité/prix. Hébergement idéal pour des surfeurs. Le camping est convivial et sympathique. Il est situé à 3 minutes en voiture du spot de La Torche.

name: Camping Le Helles
location: 55 Rue du Petit Bourg, 29120 Combrit, France
comments: This is a nice campsite - good facilities close to a lovely beach and within walking distance of the harbour at Sainte Marine. From there a passenger ferry runs to Benodet. Our only reservation is that we would have liked heated toilets and showers at this time of year (mid September) and everything has an end of season feel to it.

This is our third visit, really enjoying the facilities, indoor and outdoor pools, everywhere kept very clean and tidy, owners are brilliant very welcoming and friendly, work hard to ensure your holidays go well, will be back again next year, been on a lot of sites in France but this is our favourite. Barry and Maureen Kay, Wigan, England.
Excellent in every way.
Nice campsite with great facilities and close to the beach.
Nice clean and friendly camp site. Will definitely return another time...

name: Camping A Vouga
location: Calle Carretera, 0 Km 3, 15230 Outes, La Coruña, Spain

name: Camping Cachadelos
location: Carretera de Sanxenxo a O Grove, 110, 36960 Sanxenxo, Pontevedra, Spain
comments: Camping grande, con mucha arboleda y muy buen trato del personal, con una situación fantástica, muy cerca de la playa y a un paso del karting que prácticamente tiene en frente. Cuenta con piscina de agua salada, parque infantil y varias zonas para barbacoa. Sí hay que poner algún pero; parcelas demasiado pequeñas y falta de agua caliente para fregar.
Mt pena pena ser longe da praia
Camping bien. Emplacement tente + voiture juste. Sanitaires propres mais vétustes. Cafeteria correcte mais très bruyante.

Muy buen trato del personal,en el restaurante se come muy bien y barato.
Los bungalow de tamaño justito y muy juntos.
Recomiendo asegurarse que el bungalow q te asignen no de a la carretera
Muy agradable, con mucha arboleda y junto al mar, con preciosas vistas, atención muy amable y diligente. Amplio.

name: Deer's Glade Caravan and Camping Park
comments: Clean and tidy, great little corner of Norfolk. We stayed in the pod. Although we were nearby other pods we felt like we had our own little corner of the world. Bring firewood for the chimnea!

A compact site arranged around a children’s play area. Nice hedges between pitches, but having recently been trimmed, they were very dense and neat, rather than being wildlife havens. Pitch sizes were OK, but the short, low hedges left you very much aware of your neighbours when sitting outside the ‘van. 

Can’t fault the washrooms – lots of hot water, a chair and hooks to hang clothes on.  Need to keep an eye on water use though, one loo was permanently flushing – must have used gallons in a day !

Good service points for water and elsan disposal.

Nice little shop in reception, where we bought some wonderfully fresh local eggs – picked the ones we wanted from a basket.
Picturesque setting and very quiet. Not too pricy. Good amenities.

A great campsite with a lovely shower/toilet block and a great play area for the kids. There was a pizza oven on Friday night which was lovely (although order early to avoid disappointment) . There are some great walks and lovely pubs near by too. It is great that you are allowed open fires too! We will be back.

We have visited twice now. First time was on the main site on a 'luxury' pitch with an electric hook up and WiFi. More recently we stayed on their other site which is only used in the summer during the high season. It's not as luxurious but it has all the facilities you need, it's a short walk from the main site and they have a communal bonfire.

name: Camping Santos
location: Playa Terrón, s/n, 36620 Vilanova de Arousa, Pontevedra, Spain
comments: Todo bien, parcela amplia, con. Los caminos asfaltados,  baños limpios con  agua caliente. Piscina y la playa a la puerta del camping.

Un camping fantástico, zona ideal para venir con niños ya que es una zona muy muy tranquila. Tiene muchas zonas para explorar en los alrededores, museo Valle Inclán en Vilanova,a Illa da toxa, a ruta da pedra da auga, Cambados,... 😍😍
No tenen tabac
La terraza del bar es espectacular, con vistas a la playa y la pareja que lo atiende son super amables y encantadores.
Tranquilo y familiar

name: Camping Bayona Playa
location: Playa Ladeira, Av. José Pereira Troncoso, 2, 36393 Baiona, Pontevedra, Spain
comments: Incredible place to have a rest. I would give 5stars if the price was more affordable
Delicious lunch,  good friendly service, Great views, right on the beach front
Really well situated, just above the sea, great pool
Top no camping

name: Camping Rural Ría de Arosa II
location: Calle Balteiro, s/n, 15993 Oleiros, A Coruña, Spain
comments: Muy bien. Excelente restaurante. Grandes instalaciones. Muy limpio. Mucha vegetación. En un lugar muy tranquilo y estupendo
Baños bien y limpios. Camping muy amplio. Parcelas bien. Muy buena atencion. Camping de montaña con una buena piscina. Varias rutas en los alrededores con vistas espectaculares.

El mejor camping para ir en familia con niños. Instalaciones limpias, trato sensacional y muchas actividades para los pequeños. Una vez que llegan, ya no quieren salir. Llevamos 5 años yendo y estamos encantados.

Un camping estupendo en un enclave fantástico. Ambiente y trato muy agradable y muy cerca de playas maravillosas.
Muy recomendable. Volveré muchas veces.

Ideal para familias con niños, no hay excesiva gente. Muy entretenido el tren para los niños y las camas elásticas que no tienen ningún coste. Los caballos no dependen del camping y la persona encargada acude ocasionalmente. Mucha zona sombreada.

name: Camping La Plage Loc'h-Fri
comments: Really nice site with excellent facilities. Pitches sloping so you'll need ramps for a caravan or motorhome. Easy access to the beach.
A great site only 2 stone throws from one of the best French pages I have ever had three pleasure to walk on !
Vriendelijke uitbaters die een hart hebben voor hun gasten en ook baby's (eigen badkamer met badje voor hen). Sanitair tip top in orde, voldoende ruimte en schaduwrijke plekjes. Aanrader!

Camping que je connais depuis mes 17 ans et j'ai 47.  Il n'as pas changé...... C'est un camping super...ambiance familiale... Il reste deux étoiles car il ne veux pas augmenter par contre il vaut plus... Plage à deux mètres.... Vue sur les îles les glenans...  Un petit coin de paradis....

Super camping! Accueil formidable, sanitaires propres et neufs, camping très bien entretenu, des food truck tous les soirs, emplacement au top avec accès direct sur une superbe plage très familiale. Camping convivial j'y reviendrai sans hésiter !

name: Wyton Lakes Holiday Park
location: Banks End, Wyton, Huntingdon PE28 2AA, UK
comments: Great little site brilliant location next to river and so scenic with the trees and fishing lakes, spend hours watching the wildlife and fish jumping. There is a  pub doing meals half a mile walk along the road with stunning location on marina. Across the road from the site gate is a garden centre with farm shop selling food and there is a coffee shop  as well as a few other shops. Must stay if in the area.
Had a great weekendcamping  lovely site friendly people nice and clean toilets and shower definitely  be going back 😆🖒
Beautiful setting next to River Ouse,  well kept fishing lakes and nice and clean facilities. They even provide a washing line for your laundry..nice touch!
What a lovely place for a relaxing holiday lovely garden centre on your doorstep which houses WH Smith costa coffee outdoor clothes and a lovely butchers
Lovely site plenty to do nearby

name: Camping A Vouga
location: Carretera Muros Finisterre, km 3, 15291 Louro- Muros, A Coruña, A Coruña, Spain
comments: Great food, particularly cuttlefish & black rice and mushroom sauce pork and chips. Great for kids with ice cream and desserts with outside terrace. Prices about 25-40% higher than other local restaurants but quality food.
Right on the beach. Very good facilities. Good restaurant and bar.
Nice place but crowded. Place not for children

A relatively small campsite with friendly staff, clean facilities and about 14 sites with a million dollar view at the waterfront.

There is even a special shower room for dogs, for after they have been on the beach (off season).

So this campsite is all about the front line pitches. There are about 14 which look directly onto the stunning beach. The beach is easily accessed along the path. The pitches are tight so if if its busy, you will be very close to your neighbours. If your on the other part of the campsite then you don't get any great views from your pitch. 

The grass could be better looked after and cut.

The facilities are fine. The restaurant is great, and has views on the beach and bay. 

It takes 44 mins to walk to the town of Muros, mostly along a pavement.

There are not many campsites with direct beach access or views on Spain so if this is what your after this place is ideal. It was also very reasonable priced for what you got.

name: Camping Siglo XXI
location: Rua La Barrosa, s/n, 36988 San Vicente Do Mar, Pontevedra, Spain
comments: Nice camping, level grass plots all with private bathroom which was great to have. Very friendly staff, generous tapas with the drinks and well priced. Beaches within walking distance and the O Grove area in general is beautiful. We stayed an extra 3 nights we enjoyed it so much. Would definitely return.

Great camping ground. Everyone has a bathroom for themselves and it is right at the beach, but there is no close exit to the beach and the pits are really small. It is a little expensive but that is because of the private bathrooms so it is acceptable
Creo que es el mejor camping en el que haya estado nunca. Solo el hecho de tener baño en tu parcela es ya un lujo. Por atención, situación... es un camping de lujo. El precio es muy razonable.
Un lugar precioso. El personal y sobre todo el camarero del restaurante muy amables y profesionales. A destacar aseo completo por parcela. Un lujo

Parcelas muy justas pero todas con baño. Es el único camping que tienes tu propio baño en la parcela incluyendo lavadero.
Buen supermecado.

name: Abbotts Farm
location: Mill Rd, North Tuddenham, Dereham NR20 3DD, UK
comments: Its such a lovely place to go and you can relax here everyone is so friendly and the owner is really friendly i have had people offer to help me put up my tent and the first night being there people came over and said hi and i have now been 5 times this year and will be going back if anyone is going to the shops they are more than willing to get anything you need aswell and now when i go there some of the people come over and ask if i need any help and they will talk to you about anything it is great there is a pool there and toilets and showers and yes its a nudest place but its not just for gay people there are all sorts of people there it is amazing and dog friendly
Great place to relax clothes free. Toilets and showers definitely need an upgrade. Has an indoor pool. Be prepared for no mobile signal at this site.
Been here quite a few times and it is one of the best have used either camping or in a motorhome. The guys are lovely people and always there to help.
It's a working farm and a lovely country retreat. Naturists welcome.
Need a break from a city life, this is a place that be.

name: Fakenham Fairways
location: Burnham Market Road, Sculthorpe, Fakenham NR21 9SA, UK
comments: Fantastic little gem of a campsite stayed on the adults only part with electric. Good size pitch spotless toilet and showers,  freezer in the washing up area and a little cafe with a few essentials for sale. Tesco is just down the road. Location, it's a short walk into Fakenham if you have a dog The crown is very dog friendly and lovely Italian food. Walk right out of the campsite and a mile down the road is the cycle route 1 which 10 miles later will take you in to wells. Will definitely be returning.

A good quiet campsite (even in mid July), we made it our base camp for a week it is central for visiting different places in Norfolk each day.
Family run by two friendly ladies, the whole site appeared to be maintained by helpful family members.

Electric shower units would have been more friendly, the fixed spray heads on the wall supply too much water at force and it's cold to start with and no room to step aside until it warms up.

We have stayed there on two occasions and Will be going back there again another Year.

Lovely owners who were helpful, informative and friendly. The site is clean and well kept. The pitches are a very generous size. The showers and toilets are immaculate. There is a coffee bar which does various types of coffee and teas. The homemade cakes are delicious. There is a pitch and putt course and a driving range.

I haven't been to this driving range for years until I noticed the change! The cafe is completely new and the driving bays also finished to a clean and new style. The staff were very kind, welcoming, accomodating and helpful and it's extremely well priced. Lastly there is not a strict dress code and beginners can borrow a club if need be!
We love coming to this site for camping and come at least 4 times a year if we can. The kids love the park area at the back of the campsite and the coffee shop is great.

Tempatnya luas, bumi perkemahan berpasir, banyak pohon, namun kalau siang panas

Camping

name: Kamp Oaza Lučica
comments: Great prices, great pitch and the service was first class. We stopped in many campsites around Croatia during our cycle tour and this one was by far the best value and service. Highly recommended! Thank you or a wonderful stay.

I went here with my girlfriend, didn't expect much for such a low price. But, fourth day in and this camp offers a LOT for this price. Everyone in the reception is really nice, talkative, if you need anything, they'll want to give it to you. It's a very welcoming family camp. The beach next to the camp is small but really nice, not that many people either. But if you're looking for something more private, make sure you go south of the camp, you can walk on the beach and you come to a really nice place to be and there's no one there (in the evenings at least). Walking north of the camp gets you to the city of Drage which is a nice small town. The food prices are a bit "salty" next to the beach but if you go to the magistrala road, you'll find a great restaurant that's quite cheap.
Back to the camp, the toilets are clean and nice, there is a bakery and a fruit market, also, there are two fast food stores that are ok, not expensive either.
I really must say again that all of the workers here are great. They speak many languages (Italian, German, French, English and Croatian of course).
Recommended for low budget travelers as well as for families! 10/10

name: Camping Miran Pirovac
comments: One of the worst camps - awful layout, no security (missing fence around the camp), broken bed, roof was leaking (rainy day), bed bugs, blood on bed, broken stuff in mobile homes... we saw police coming a few times during our stay as people who stayed in the camp didn't want to pay, so camp management called police to get the money. You don't get what you paid for. You also don't have much to do in nearby small town - hardly any bar or shop accepts any kind of credit card (cash only).

Mobile homes
Pros:
The crew is helpful, and they are doing their best to make you feel comfortable.
You can use the Hotel's equipments, they are not too good but better than nothing.
All of the mobile houses have air conditioner.
There's a small shop in the camping.
Cons:
The city is 15 minutes by foot.
The sea is a bit blurry.
The mobile houses are standing in the sun.
There's no real road or path that goes to the mobile houses, and if you come back at night, you can't see where are you going.
Sometimes the tap water just stops, and thanks to Murphy's law always in the worst moment.
There's no wifi in or near the mobile houses, you have to sit in the hotel if you want to browse.
The mobile houses look like they are not finished, plastic pipes all around, and scrapwood roof over the terrace.

The overall experience was really bad, and for this price you can't find a worse place than this.

name: ATC Tatranská Štrba
location: Slovakia Close 0, 2188 Roodepoort-Cosmo City-Tatranská Štrba, Slovakia
comments: Kemp jsem vybral na základě vysokého hodnocení. Nejsem žádná fajnovka, ale co se týká sociálních zařízení v tomto kempu, nemám slov. Do kempu jezdíme jen na přespání, celý den jsme na tůrách, takže většinou kvalita WC a sprch nehraje velkou roli. WC nepřikotvený - určitě by nikdo nebyl rád, když v plném zápalu se trochu zavrtí a i s WC, který zřejmě zažil ještě Československo, se převrhne. Absence mýdla na WC, čekání fronty na sprchu a kdo je průbojnější, tak vyhrává atd. Cena je relativně vysoká, za noc cca 170 korun včetně žetonu na sprchování. Místo na stanování je za potřebí důkladně vybrat, jelikož celý kemp je v mírném svahování. Jediný plus shledávám lokalitu, která je vážně super!

Plus za położenie (jedyny chyba kamping w słowackich Tatrach wysokich) i fajną atmosferę. Odejmuję 1 gwiazdkę za relację ceny (14 euro/3 osoby śpiące w samochodzie bez rozstawiania namiotu) do jakości sanitariatów. Co prawda czystych, ale proszących się o remont. Przydałoby się też wyrównać teren - b. trudno znaleźć płaskie miejsce. Ogólnie jednak jak najbardziej polecam.
Kemp byl super, obsluha vynikající, nebyl žádný problém. Můžu vřele doporučit :-)

comments: Had a birthday party here for my 7 year old.. wow. Best place ever for them indoor and outdoor activities pet farm and plenty of food and drinks with sweets cake and ice cream after. Loved it staff fabulous and can't do enough and all for 10 Euro a child and no time limits. Can't recommend this place enough. Will definitely go back especially for the latte by the huge fire☺

Kids did not want to leave, best campsite ever. It's back to basics what camping is all about. Staff a very friendly, easy going. Access to pet farm, rides, tadpoles hunt Inthe evening. If your up early egg's for breakfast. Very relaxing, and will be back.

The people here are very helpful and obliging.     They come around collecting campers rubbish and delivering firewood.  There is loads for kids to do (play spaces, barrel rides, petting zoo, pony rides) and a cafe (vegans BYO soya milk).  There is also a camp kitchen with fridges, freezers and a microwave although the fridges could do with some attention.  The price for one tent with up to five people is excellent and electric hook ups are available.
Kids (5yr old)had great fun. So much to do. Great safe space. Staff very welcoming. Great value for money. Simple food menu. Must visit again.

name: Nore Valley Park
location: Nore Valley Park, Annamult, Bennettsbridge, Co. Kilkenny, R95 RXR4, Ireland
comments:
This place has non-stop farm fun for young and old. We got a great welcome and the whole place is very family oriented. You can tell how invested the whole family is in creating an enjoyable family friendly environment including engaging local schools in the rearing of chickens.

We just got back from a three night stay in the camp ground with three generations of the family. We all enjoyed checking in with the animals throughout the day at our leisure. We met goats, sheep, ducks, geese and chickens to name a few. The wobbler/toddler was most impressed with the tractor rides and hasn't stopped talking about them since (neighbours, creche and strangers alike have all heard about it). Grandad and grandma enjoyed the river walk and meeting the fishermen on the river. Mammy and daddy enjoyed the animal feeds / meet and greet morning and evening. I personally enjoyed looking at all the ingenious metal fabrications done on-site. The toy diggers in the sand pit are reputed to have survived several generations, surviving thanks to the workshop across the lane. 

The campsite is well maintained with ample clean and well equipped showers and toilets. The home produce in the shop is worth the trip alone and very reasonably priced. The kids were having great fun on the playground when not on the farm or enjoying activities. Important for us the camp is well regulated for safe enjoyment by families. There is a quiet nighttime environment, no excessive speeding by cars and dogs kept on leads.

Great place for kids. Lots of activities. We stayed overnight in campervan. Facilities were very clean and perform was great for the kids. Also they had a great time playing crazy golf and running around outside. Felt very safe for the kids.

My family and myself have stayed twice in the past two years and last night we attended your scary maze. We love the campsite , the facilities are absolutely amazing and there’s plenty to do . Your maze was very well planned and very very scary but worth the experience. Couldn’t fault the place at all and your staff are amazing and all very helpful.

By far one of the best campsites we have camped in. Absolutely spotless clean with cleaners constantly going around making sure it's kept that way. Exceptional farm with so many beautiful animal's including an ostrich, buffalo and barn Owl to say the least. So much for the children to do that they just go play all day without any complaints. The fresh bread,pizza,tarts and scones are such a treat. We have stayed 4 times and will definitely be returning soon. Staff are fantastic with the children.  All round amazing place.

I will be returning here for the 4th year in a row next week. Can't recommend Nore Valley highly enough, there is something new every year we've been. My children are 7, 6 and 2 and every year it's been a great experience for them. They love feeding the animals and the adults in our group love it too! The baked goods and pizzas in the shop are a real treat, as is the home made jam. The children are already looking forward to the hay jump, and the adults to the archery. There's no problem getting them out of bed in the morning because they won't miss feeding the animals at 9am each day. We look forward to continuing to come here for many years to come.

name: Greenwood Loch Holiday Park & Activity Centre
comments:
Just had a long weekend there last week. Excellent Staff, site and immaculate facilities. Definitely one to visit as they add on all their additional facilities and activities. They have put a lot of hard work and thought into this site.

Amazing site lots to do highly recommend  it

name: River Valley Holiday Park
comments: Spent a few days there this July. Took my caravan down from Belfast. Clean friendly and welcoming. Also has an adult only part of the caravan park. Just beside its own micro Brewery selling craft beers.. Lovely indeed. A cute little village also with shops and eatery's to choose from.

Hi,I stayed at River Valley with my 8 year old daughter and her 8 year old friend.We were staying in a mobile home and on the last night we booked the Tree House as a special treat.The mobile home was very poorly equipped in the kitchen- and there was no grill.
The tree house had absolutely nothing in it- not even a bin! No equipment whatsoever.
The park boasts great facilities- however- outside of the playground everything costs you money- you can't even use the tennis court without paying- I certainly don't mind paying for a children's club- but everything else is buying tokens and more tokens and more tokens.

lovely campsite love the fact that there is am adult only section. Unfortunately it  should have be child free, however during the three weeks of my stay, several adults did sneaked in there children or grandchildren and some of the golden campers you would have thought because of there age that they would have behaved a bit better at bedtime instead of partying they should have turned down there music and voices.

Anyway the site is dog friendly and I was able to walk my dogs down the lovely lanes unfortunately other dog owners must have forgotten that they had to pick up there dogs poo 💩 this ruins it for other sensible dog owners. 

If your taking a dog with you on holiday please pick up your dogs poo 💩 🐶 

Security is good when you can find them they tend to stay around the mix area of the campsite rather than the adult section. 

Clean toilet 🚽 and shower 🚿 facilities the restaurant is always packed food is excellent
Would advise to book for evening meals.
A peaceful clean well cared for caravan/camp site and nice part of the country, great for walks very scenic area.
We have stayed on this site many times especially the couple's site it is very well laid out and kept well. It has a lovely walk right around the site. Would recommend.

It was very safe for the children and as there was no pub on site  the adults were well behaved. I will definitely be going back to this beautiful location. Thank you Niamh for looking after us.

comments: Nice camp. Really soft grass for those who camp in tents, the ponies behind the tent is cute bonus. Price per person was 9€, owner recommended some nice stuff to see around, and been really helpful and easy-going.
Lower pitches are level on on hard core where as top pitches are on grass. The grey and black waste is on the hill. There is also toilet waste at back of the toilet block. 30mins to town center.

name: Green Adventure
comments: What a wonderful place to stay very clean and friendly owner. We definitely be back

The place is very filthy and dangerous to stay with 
Slippery staircase, 
Exposed live wires, 
Secretly operated video surveillance,
Not fixed and especially dangerous for children loose switches, mirrors and glass covered picture frames,
The sitting coaches are unstable with the risk of legs jammed,
Try to sleep and safely wake up with the lamp just 10 inches from your head..
I just commented a few pictures I made on arrival..
I pray that your green adventure will not become bloody red..

This is an absolutely lovely place situated in the hills of Ireland. It is an active working farm. The accommodations are quiet, clean, and comfortable. The view from here is spectacular!

The owners of Green Adventure are very friendly and accommodating to your needs and schedule. We were originally supposed to stay in the hostel, but there was a large group celebrating a birthday in the adjacent room so the owners allowed us to stay in the farmhosue. They were concerned about the noise from the party. 

So instead of staying in a hostel, we stayed for two nights in the large 4 bedroom house, complete with a enormous kitchen, dining room, and living room. The house is lovely and it was extremely generous of the hosts for letting us stay there. The beds were comfortable and there are plenty of bathrooms for everyone. We were welcome to use the wood burning stove/fireplace and the charcoal grill if we wanted. 

They also invited us to walk around the farm. There are some nice farm roads to walk down to go see the cows (and pick blackberries, if they are ripe). There is also a barn and animal shed with two large pigs, much to our amusement. A swingset and sandbox kept the kids entertained, not to mention that the owner's own children were very friendly and wanted to play with our kids, who thoroughly enjoyed the adventure.

There is a zorb ball course and a zip line. The zip line was currently being worked on, but the owners let us have a go in the giant Zorb balls, free of charge. It was tons of fun! The crew helping with the Zorb balls was jovial and we enjoyed talking with them. 

There are a couple of very friendly dogs here, Buddy and Buttercup, who came and romped around with us. They were lovely and followed us around while we were exploring the farm. Buttercup was especially sweet and we had fun playing ball with her. 

I'd highly recommend this place for anyone who enjoys adventures, farms, and good company.

Keep in mind, though, that it is a working farm. You will hear the sounds of pigs, cows, and farm equipment. There is dirt, mud, and animal droppings around the barn area, so if you want to visit the animals, be careful where you step. This is not a place for nice shoes and fancy clothing. This is a place to explore a farm, wear overalls and boots, get dirty, get muddy, and have a grand old time. You won't regret it!
Great place facilities very clean has electric for camping

name: Hidden Valley Holiday Park
location: Lower Main Street, Glasnarget North, Rathdrum, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
comments:
Be advised before booking....

I have mixed views on this site, We are a family of 4, two children. Our second year staying here.

As a family we have holidayed at campsites all across France, Ireland and the south of England.  We have experience of what is expected of a good site.

The area is outstanding, so much to do for families and couples. The facilities at Hidden Vally are very good.  Staff are friendly if under pressure.  Everything is cleaned regularly and kept to a good standard.
The facility has lots to do during the day and everyone can relax and enjoy.  

However at night time the positive experience is ruined by the disrespect of quite a considerable number of other campers who treat the area as if they are the only guests. 

Noise levels, shouting, yelling, larking about - adults as much as children keep the majority of guests awake into the small hours.  Nothing is done about this by the staff.

Despite the fantastic facilities and region to explore I doubt I will return here with my family next year.  Lack of sleep, frustration at being kept awake at night by swearing louts and yelling children playing at all hours of the night is not acceptable.

If you don't mind the above then come and enjoy a lovely campsite.  If you wish to rest at night, and not have yourself and children kept awake to the small hours then avoid.

Amenities brilliant, really quiet at night very well managed. We were only there for a night but we'll definitely go back for a long weekend. Loads for kids to do. A river runs right through it where fires can be lit. Would've heard a pin drop after 11pm.
We have been here both overnight and just on day trips. Great fun for kids lots to do. At the waters edge so be prepared with smaller kids.

Great for young families, loads of activities such as boating, climbing frames, swimming and an area to build your own campfire. Staff were 10/10 friendly and helpful.
Along with a local village walking distance away. I would recommend it to everyone

Staff here were helpful and facilities were in good order. Pitch was reasonable, grass was in poor nick. Not the place for a quiet getaway but Rathdrum is two minutes up the road and a nice place to spend a few hours. Great site for those with kids in tow, not so much for those without.

Pero lo mas lejos del agua deben ser como 100metros. A mi me encanto.
Los senderos son iluminados y tambien hay llaves con agua y basureros cerca de cada sitio de Camping.

Lo que falta mejorar.
Es que en las Mesitas de los Camping tengan Techo para los dias de lluvia. 
Ya que si llueve. Tienes que comer dentro del auto o dentro de la Carpa.
Y los Baños tambien deberian Mejorar. Son Limpios pero no tiene ampolletas en los cubiculos por los que al Cerrar la Puerta no se ve mucho.

comments: Pésima atención. Se nota que las personas que atienden no son los dueños y solo tienen el camping en concesión. También se nota que desprecian a los turistas argentinos. Lindo lugar, lastima la gente que lo maneja. Para no volver...

Este camping es el peor  de la zona,  fuimos maltratados verbalmente y casi ficamente por cometer el error de llevar nuestra mascota y con niños presentes, cuando lo correcto era el que el administrador nos explicara de buena manera que no se podía llevar mascotas y lo hubiésemos entendido bien, pero no, l o hizo de manera grosera y diciéndonos que  éramos unos ordinarios  por llevar a nuestro perro y lo más gracioso los perro se paseaban en frente nuestro, fue una ironía y nos hizo pasar un muy mala experiencia! Al parecer él administrador estaba estresado!
El camino  de acceso está muy destruido y el valor es muy elevado para un camping, con lo que vale un día ahí pague dos días en un hostel de puerto varas con baño y desayuno incluido.
Este camping es una mierda ...no vayan!!!

La atención de los dueños es pésima , los administradores tienen un pésimo trato, a penas llegamos nos contestaron de muy mala forma. Nos hicieron este primer día de estadía un muy mal momento, cuando uno viene feliz por las vacaciones, y más encima no dejan salir después de las 23:00 y si lo hacen se debe dejar los autos afuera, parecemos verdaderos presos de la hora, INSÓLITO.los antiguos dueños eran amables un siete, lo recomiendo por su naturaleza pero nada más. AGREGÓ ESTO DE ÚLTIMO MOMENTO YA QUE CON CARABINEROS QUERÍAN DESLOJAR A LOS CAMPISTAS POR DIVERTIRSE UN DÍA SABADO Y LOS QUERIAN DESALOJAR DOMINGO TEMPRANO CON NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS.
