Excelente

name: Camping Idro Ecomuseum Delle Acque Ridracoli
location: Borgo Via Giosuè Borsi, 47021 Ridracoli,Bagno di Romagna FC, Italy
comments: Ottimo punto sosta per la visita del parco,  13 piazzole servite da bagni con docce calde.  Presente zona barbecue,  un campo da tennis,  parco giochi per  bambini.  La reception è  all'ingresso del museo e quindi chiude alle 18:30. Non custodito. La notte si vedono animali subito fuori il recinto,  noi abbiamo visto daini,  uno scoiattolo ed un tasso. Arrivate carichi di provviste,  non ci sono alimentari vicino.

name: International Camping Relax
location: Via del Lavoro, 10, 40048 PIANO DEL VOGLIO BO, Italy
comments: Campeggio buono come sosta. Bagni vecchi ma puliti, personale gentile. Molti stanziali. Tranquillità estrema...
Qui é un posto bellissimo
Tranquilo un vero relax

Zumindest in der Nebensaison toll.
Schöne Lage, viele Wandermöglichkeiten.
Für einen Zwischenstopp erste Wahl!
Proprio un bel campeggio, ti senti in famiglia, ideale per rilassarsi, stare in mezzo alla natura, sentire gli uccellini... Fare passeggiate...

name: Camping Il Sergente-Agofar Sas Di Farnetani Silvano E C
location: Via Bolognese, 24, 50031 Barberino di Mugello FI, Italy
comments:
Alla fine di una tappa della Via degli Dei abbiamo trovato in questo luogo un'amichevole accoglienza, una fresca birra ed una cena da leccarsi i baffi, con diversi piatti (tortelli con diversi condimenti, tagliatelle, rosticciata) che abbiamo avuto modo di provare in gruppo, scambiandoceli per l'assaggio.
Tutto di ottima qualità, molto apprezzato da tutti noi.
L'alloggio guadagna un punteggio un po' minore ma stiamo parlando di un campeggio e non credo ci sia da lamentarsi per qualche spiffero nella casetta...!

Sehr schöner Campingplatz mit familiärer Betreuung.
Ausgezeichnete und sehr saubere Sanitäranlagen.
Bello

name: Camping Village Il Poggetto
location: Via Il Poggetto, 143, 50067 Troghi FI, Italy
comments:
The gave us an efficient welcome; you are shown around the site by electro cart to choose a pitch - which is very convenient. The pitches are apropriate in size and you can have sun or shade. The swimming pool is nice, too, but you have to wear a bathing cap (Hey, I didn't have to wear a bathing cap since the 1960s!!). The restaurant is popular with the locals, so you'd better reserve a table. The toilet block is clean with sufficient showers, but there are no single person washing units which is a must these days. We don't want to stand in a row like we used to in the boy scouts' camp and clean our (false) teeth and wobbly armpits, do we? If you've got a dog, beware! There are no dog walks around the campsite, although the site is in the countrysite. The bus to Firenze is convenient. It is cheap and it takes an hour to go to the city centre. It's bearably crowded if you travel by 11 o'clock. The return trip might be more crowded, so be prepared for little space on the bus.
The near road can be quite noisy at times.
It's got everything including a very good pizza restaurant and at only 21 euros (17 if you an acai member) a night

Check in for motorhome was easy and we had no reservation. Staff spoke excellent English. Pitch was adequate and somewhat shady. Bathrooms were excellent, clean and close to pitch. We used laundry and got all clothes in one load, money well spent. There was a holiday party during our stay, free fruit and wine, fun bonus. Pool rules are silly, who wears a swim cap in this day an age unless you are a prof swimmer!! I just wore a baseball hat. Bought tickets for bus at reception and it was an easy trip into Florence, just beware the bus station home is a little difficult to find and the buses may run early!! Unbelievable but we missed out by 5 mins. 🙃
Outstanding campsite, great facilities and friendly staff

People, dont be stupid and buy your bus ticket from the driver, like everyone would do it. You save 50%!
The camping is 24h noisy because of the highway nearby. No soap in the toilets. 5€ for 1x washing machine. Must pay with cash if you stay less than 3 days. They try to store your ID until checkout!!!

name: Camping Le Sorgenti
location: Via della Faggiola, 19, 50035 Palazzuolo Sul Senio FI, Italy
comments: Great hosts! Intriguing campsite, with always a new beautiful view to see around its site! Oh and the road to get to the site, with its mountain and vineyard views are truly breathtaking! Although I was a solo English motorcyclist passing through, I can see it is great for not just people like me but families as well, its pool and facilities are clean and 'up to date!' Must go back again! Keep working on the english guys ;) then again you're pretty much there anyway!

Awesome campsite, with a lot of shade, very friendly owners and a relaxing atmosphere. The owners are constantly working to improve the campsite and are available to help you with any problem you might encounter. The toilets and showers don't look like much from the outside, but on the inside they are renewed and clean. Very charming look in general, where not everything has to look perfect. Would definitely recommend.

We loved our short time here. Gemma (owner) was very helpful. The camp is tucked on a hill side between pine and other trees, giving nice shade from the summer heat. The campsite is really quiet (not like a lot in Italy) which we loved. The facilities were excellent with hot showers and very clean toilets. There is a small shop and bar. 

Mountain bike and walking tracks are all around the campsite and the nearest village has restaurants and shops.

There is a lovely back road over hills to Florence and lots of small villages to explore locally.

Bel posto immerso nel verde e lontano da grossi centri urbani, i gestori sono davvero gentili e disponibili e i prezzi più che giusti.
Siamo stati lì 4 giorni con due cani, ovviamente da tenere al guinzaglio, in completo relax ad ammirare il cielo notturno tra gli alberi.

Unica pecca la presenza del barbecue solo centralizzato che per la piazzola che avevamo scelto noi (la più lontana e tranquilla) risultavo un po' scomodo da raggiungere. Sarebbe bello poter avere barbecue per ogni raggruppamento di piazzole, anche se immagino sia impossibile proprio perche sono immerse nel verde tra castagneti secolari

Siamo appena rientrati da questo splendido campeggio. Anche se abbiamo fatto solo due giorni e una notte, ci siamo subito resi conto della bellezza del paesaggio, della cordialità dei titolari e di quanto sia tenuto bene questo piccolo ma grazioso campeggio. Una vera perla inserita fra alberi locali e adiacente a splendide camminate e un ruscello che genera una bellissima cascata dove trascorrere qualche ora fra la natura in totale sicurezza per i bambini e relax per gli adulti. I campeggiatori stanziali ci sono sembrati gentili. All'interno c'è un bar e un piccolo market per ogni evenienza con la possibilità di prenotare paste fresche e pane per il giorno successivo. Carina la piccola piscina fuori terra per i bambini. Servizi igienici puliti. Campeggio ad alto tasso di serenità e tranquillità. Consigliato a chi cerca fresco, piazzole quasi tutte all'ombra, momenti di pace e serenità. Ci torneremo sicuramente.

name: Camping San Giusto
location: Via Castra, 71, 50050 Limite Sull'Arno FI, Italy
comments:
Wild camping feel as pitches are neatly segregated by trees and roots. Views are stunning once you look through the trees or go to one of the higher up pitches. A few toilet blocks meaning you don't have to walk far which was handy. Some toilet blocks are better than others. The central ones by pitch 8 or 9 seemed to be the best. Facilities were simple but clean and had hot water for no extra charge. The usual seat-less toilets we'd come to expect in Italy and no paper or soap provided. Showers were hot and there was space to change and leave your stuff separate to the shower.  The pool was clean and fairly quiet even though were we there in high season.
The highlight was that we enjoyed a fantastically warm welcome from the daughter of the owner who spoke excellent English. We stayed here a couple of nights and found it to be a really relaxing, scenic area. We road tripped round Italy and Italian campsites for 3 weeks and this was by far one of the friendliest. Grazie mille!

Fantastic, family-owned campsite.

If you're after a quiet, rural campsite with outstanding views of the Tuscan countryside, Camping Village San Giusto is the place to head for. Set on a hillside overlooking the Arno Valley, this place is about as picturesque as you could wish for, complete with spacious camp sites for tents and trailers.

Food in the onsite restaurant is cooked by the site owner, and it's some of the best down-home Italian food I've had in years. If you end up staying here, be sure to have at least one meal at the site itself.

About the only thing which made my stay less than perfect, were the WC/Shower facilities, which are in dire need of an overhaul, and cleaned infrequently. Hopefully this will be taken care of by 2017.

The best accomodation to discover  Montalbano area, the Medici's villas and the Leonardo da Vinci's birthplace.
Is perfect to start a bike tour on the hills to have fun on perfect trails or to discover the quiet and charme of the renaissance villas.
With our bikes and guides this will be easy and funny.
Bike rental provided in the camping.
Beautiful view and really nice hosts!
Very Good camping!!!

name: Camping Barco Reale
location: Via dei Nardini, 11, 51035 Lamporecchio PT, Italy
comments: The camp site is really nice and has a good equipment. But the WiFi is horrible! They take extra money for it but don't provide the throughput for that many people. It hardly works at all.
Great camping. Nice swimming pool, good animation team

Beautiful campsite, perfect bath-houses, really 5 star camping in every way. Nice people for the camping and super nice staff in the restaurant. Amazing food for not much money! A go-to for everyone who goes to Tuscany!

Nice camp site. Stunning location. Stayed here with Eurocamp. Great pools, very clean, good loungers and gorgeous outlook. The shallow pool is kid friendly, slide is a little steep though. The camp restaurant is great for all times of day. Very friendly staff and great food. Mini market is on the pricy side. Would come again.

Camping with nice places. Great views, clean   sanitary. Restaurant is ok but very pricey for Italy standards. Minimarket is not servicing the guests but ripping them off with their prices. Take the effort to go to the supermarket which takes you about 20 minutes. 
Pool is really nice with great views. Also great for small children.

name: Campeggio Montequestiolo
comments: Giorgio was very nice and the whole place had a peaceful feeling

Zeer rustige en stille camping. Wij waren op de fiets onderweg en na een kleine klim bereikten we de camping. Vriendelijke eigenaren die een klein woordje Engels spreken. Er is een kleine bar waar je ook kunt eten (huisgemaakte gerechten).

Ottimo camping immerso nel verde, gestori cortesi e disponibili, veramente completo , dove trovi piazzole spaziose con allaccio elettrico, servizio lavanderia, stireria, wifi, cucina locale. Ideale per staccare la spina e ricaricarsi. Non economico ma ne vale la pensa.
Campeggio tranquillo isolato un po' lontano dal centro personale molto disponibile e cordiale.
Perché é un posto alternativo ed interessante gestito da una splendida persona

name: Camping Village Panoramico Fiesole
comments: Great camping ground with modern cabins. Can bring tents and campers. Very close to Florence with a convenient bus. Restaurant had good food and the pool was refreshing (bring your own bathing cap if you don't want to buy one).

One of the best campsites in Europe. I have stayed at many campsites in my lifetime and this is certainly up there with the best. Prior to my last visit in September 2017 (about 10 days ago) I stayed there about 20 years ago. Very little has changed in that time. The staff are always busy cleaning the place up. The pool is swept and cleaned every day, and the views of Firenze (Florence) are absolutely amazing. We stayed in a chalet and it had excellent air conditioning and the bathroom was very clean. That swimming pool was a lifesaver as it was very hot on the days we were there. After watching the tortoises, that have an enclosure on the campsite, for a few minutes each day, it was great just sitting looking out at the views with a decent bottle of wine and some beautiful cheese sandwiches. Staff are very friendly and always able to answer questions about the area in some depth. Lovely experience would definitely recommend it and hope one day to visit again. Fiesole itself is well worth visiting. Beautiful village with many attractions dating back to the Roman era. When the church bells are rung it is so beautiful, and there are shuttle buses running from the campsite to Fiesole so that you can take a bus into Firenze. Stay at the campsite, you wont be disappointed

The staff are very personable and helpful. The view from the restaurant is gorgeous and the spaces for the tents are a good size and in the shade from the tree's which made it feel cool even on the hot days. Nice walk to the local town if 10 minutes and 1.5 hour hike to Florence from the campsite.

Superior mobile homes are clean, and nice. Beds comfortable, and shower great. For a few nights stay really good. There is a pool which is good. Fiesole is only a short distance away which is walkable but there are shuttle buses running to and from through the out the day.

This place a bit ruined. Some walls and fences  tumbled down. View just from swimming pool where you have to wear cup (buy it for 3 €) and it closes at 7pm. The lavatories not so clean. I think the camping would be a nice place after renovating. The shuttle bus is necessary.🚐

name: Camping Riva del Setta
location: Rioveggio BO Via Ginepri 65, 40036 Monzuno BO, Italy
comments: Friendly staff. Nice free pool. Warm showers only for a fee. Only cold showers are free. No toilet paper.

LOCALISATION: good only if you have to rest while travelling long distance. Othervise no point to stay there.

CAMPSITE:  grass  ground; a lot of shade, small shop  OK

FACILITIES & TOILETS: DIRTY, HARDLY ACCEPTABLE;  NO toilet paper, NO soap (!!!) few showers, most of them only with cold water. Horrible...

STAFF: english speaking, nice, helpfull

PRICE: COULD BE MORE FAMILIY FRIENDLY.... BUT GENERALLY - OK

GENERAL:  2,5 Google stars out of 5 (max)

Wij hebben 1 nacht met de camper gestaan. Met elektra. Handig als je Italiaans spreekt. Er zijn meer plekken zonder elektra. Eenvoudige, schone camping vlak naast de snelweg. Met een klein maar prima zwembad.

Pro:
-Piscina gratis per i campeggiatori. Direi che è il punto di forza del camping.
Contro:
-Bagni: non attrezzati (es. carta igienica sempre assente)
-Docce calde solo a pagamento (docce fredde gratis)
Per 5/6 € a persona di ingresso + 9 € di piazzola mi aspettavo un servizio un pochino migliore. Tuttavia l'esperienza è stata soddisfacente.

Un posto tranquillo per vhi ama state in mezzo alla natura. Gente vordiale , buona l"organizzazione e la disponibilita' del personale.  Servizi sempre in ordine e puliti, al ristorante si mangia benissimo e poi la piscina.... Sono tre anni che ci veniamo col camper a passare una settimana col nostro nipotinoe ci siamo sempre trovati benissimo.   Unico neo : mancano i collegamenti con i centri abitati che a piedi e tutto in salita sono faticosi da raggiungere e manca un vero negozio interno.

name: Camping Village Mugello Verde
location: Via Massorondinaio, 39, 50038 Scarperia e San Piero FI, Italy
comments: Massive territory and really nice staff. Enjoyed my stay over there but only enter from the first gate. You sadly can not enter from the Gods Trail and you have to make a huge circle. Overall great experience and the swimming pool required swimming hats so really clean and neat place to go. Bathroom was so what decent. Overall a good place to go and relax. Recommend! There is also table tennis and pool. What are you waiting for 😀
Great structure and kindly staff. Just the access from the city center walking is in a road without walkside.
Beautiful campground. Lovely staff. Good amenities. Quiet during the week. Fantastic find when we decided to leave Florence for another day.
Good base for going to Mugello, a little expensive for what you get but was the best option. Staff are friendly.

Le casette sono piccole ma abbastanza pulite. Doccia spaziosa e prezzi più che onesti. Perfetto per chi vuole andare a votare in pista ce sempre posteggio vicino alle casette e il ristorante è aperto sino a tardi così come la reception. Consigliato. Lettini singoli molto piccoli per chi è alto deve adattarsi sempre di un camping village si parla :) ! Piscina spaziosa per l estate!!!!

name: Boone KOA
location: 123 Harmony Mountain Ln, Boone, NC 28607, USA
comments: Great getaway. My boys and I enjoyed the quiet quaint little mountain. The goats and donkeys were adorable. The owners kept the campground clean. We stayed during the 4th and it was still very quiet and peaceful. Looking forward to coming back again soon.
Shaded spots, but small. Carry tire levelers as most spots slope downward. Pool is very small. Employees seemed nice. Several full timers in the campground.
Stayed in the cabin there at the campgrounds staff was excellent campgrounds were well taken care of had a great time
Great, clean amenities and great store with great views and activities make this a great place for a mountain getaway!  Highly recommend nearby Grandfather mountain as well!

Honest evaluation:
1. No cable. Yes, I am at a campground, however; I am in an RV. I want tv for news and weather. 
2. Poor wifi. 
3. No mountain view. 
4. Not easy for large RVs to maneuver.
5. $45 a night to have electric and water.

name: Camping De La Joie
location: 640 Rue George-Muir, Ville de Québec, QC G2N 2H3, Canada
comments:
I extended my stay and loved it!!
If you are looking for a quiet place to stay surrounded by nature but close to the city this is your spot!
Campground goes up a large hill just outside of town giving you a spectacular view onto Québec city day and night.
The facilities are all very clean and they have everything you need.
The people running the place are just the nicest and speak perfect english! They live on the campground and are always available and at help. Thank you!
I would definitely come back again!!

Amazing place to park our trailer for 2 nights on our way to the East Coast from Toronto! Very clean and super friendly. Great place to visit if you have children as they have a great playground area and a beautiful pool. Highly recommend staying here!

Sometimes google ratings really help. We are driving from Toronto to Nova Scotia. We stayed a night on the trip to NS. Loved it so much we are staying tonight on our way back. We chose it because if the comments. Clean? Spotless! Showers are immaculate. Really friendly staff. We love it.

We visited in September 2017 and had a great experience, everyone was very helpful and spoke English very well (my French is not so good) and we enjoyed the shuttle that went into Old Quebec city and we used it several times at a cost of $8 per person. The campsites were nice and big and shady and the washrooms, showers and laundry facilities were clean and well maintained. I wasn't too happy about having to pay for wifi. I  paid $10 for a week before I found out it was per device so only my phone had wifi. Oh well, at least it worked. All in all a very nice campground about a 20 minute car ride from Old Quebec.
Such a incredible recepcionist and so kind with us. The place is very well equipment. 10 stars 💖

name: Beach Lake St. Joseph
location: 7001, Rte de Fossambault, Fossambault-sur-le-Lac, QC G3N 1X7, Canada
comments: Nice beach, nice sand, nice people!
Amazing!! Great shallow water for kids
Fun. Lovely lake
small beach but clean
Lots activities

name: Panoramique | Camping VR et chalets Parkbridge
location: 464 Rte François Gignac, Portneuf, QC G0A 2Y0, Canada
comments: Up a steep hill from Hwy 132 but close to the road. Massive place for campers/seasonals (800 spots or so) with a few left over for tents and overnighters. Unfortunately, these are about a kilometer from the bathrooms. A slight discount was offered for cyclists, but wifi is extra.

We are 5 cyclists biking across Canada.  We typically pitch our 3 small tents on one site.  Although this campground says they are cyclist friendly they wanted to charge for 3 sites when we only needed 1.  Their concession was to drop the price from $28.75 to $25 per tent making it a whopping $75 for one small tent site.  We pushed on to the next campground instead!!!

The campground adverts itself as "Panoramique", eg having a view over the St. Laurence River - nope; only few privileged sites have a view; the restaurant was awful, the worst food we ever had. The pool closes at eight - and this for 60 CAD, WIFI not included!! NB: We traveled from Vancouver to Halifax, this was the worst campground we ever stayed at! A real rip-off.

It has a great area for the tents right next to a automatic waterfall and it was great to fall asleep with that sound. All the staff and RVs folks are really friendly, they gave me a cyclist special rate of $28,75, stayed here for 1 night. 
The only downside I found was that the showers are 75 cents/5mins, thing I thought was included in the rate and there were tractors working around the tent area when I stayed there.

Je fait en moyenne 12-14 camping par été mais la cest le boute du boute.
Vraiment ordinaire .La table a pique nique était asser mure que j'osait pas m’assoire dessus.Les golf car se promene a journée longue et il y en a pour les fous et les fin.Rien a faire a part une très petite piscine et un module de jeu genre une glissade et deux balançoire.Les arbre on peut les compté sur une main, du soleil du matin au soir pas d'ombre. Les douche sont en céramique très très glissante et pas d'endroit ou placer ton linge au sec a part de l'autre coté de la porte ou le monde entre sinon tout deviens mouiller.Casse-croûte fermer,piscine fermer raison chicane ou mal entendu qu'ont nous dit ca reste a voir. Le prix est plus chère que tout les autre que j'ai fait et on s'entend que un aire d'été ou bien genévrier ou Grand R cest pas mal bon et il sont moin chère la nuitée.La seul mais vraiment seule chose positive est la grandeur des terrain.

name: Scenic View Campground LLC
location: 283 Scenic View Dr, Tioga, PA 16946, USA
comments: Beautiful view from our campsite it also has a restroom and showers and a small store. This campsite was a great deal.
The view is nice and the people are quiet

We love camping through out the summer. The camp ground outings are family oriented. The view in the summer is beautiful and the leaves this fall were to. Fred is always willing to help if you need anything.

name: Canyon Country Campground
comments: Great secluded campground within walking distance of the canyon and a short drive from the quaint little town of Wellsboro.  Cabins are cozy and clean, other campers are friendly and the staff is great.  Say hi to Dewey at the office, you won't regret it!  The cost is very reasonable and well worth it, a great experience!

Never having been to the area I got lucky finding a cabin here. It turned out to be more secluded and scenic than some other places I looked at, and also at a much better price. The cabins and amenities are clean and very well maintained and the staff is very friendly. I will definitely return in the future.

Great proximity to the PA grand canyon. This is camping- no tv reception or cable; limited cell service; nice hiking trail to the state park visitors center. The town of Wellsboro is a short drive and great scenery all around.

I've been going there for years and this was my first disappointing trip. Was given one price during the phone reservation but a higher one when I showed up. People kept showing up after quiet hours started so it was noisy when trying to sleep. Car doors slamming music playing air pumps for mattresses going after midnight. Septic smells every twenty minutes or so. Made it difficult to sit down to eat. We even left a night early. Brought it up to the office. "I'll have to take a look" but never did. Just disappointed after this visit.
Great place to camp.  Within walking distance from the lookout tower and overlook at Leonard Harrison State Park.  Lots of tree cover in the campground that give some nice privacy.

name: The Little Campground
location: 564 Curtis Creek Rd, Elk Park, NC 28622, USA
comments: This is such a wonderful little campground!  First off the owner (Maxine) was so gracious and not only helped me back into my site but also checked on us each day and made sure we had everything we needed. Our site was next to a nice running stream that was so peaceful to listen to and was also great entertainment for our kids. And the sites are very large so you have plenty of room to relax. Plus you are in close proximity to everything around this area so very convenient to go out during the day and explore with lots to do. We will definitely be back and so appreciate all the care and attention from the owners and letting us stay at their beautiful campground!

Nice spot not far from Banner Elk. Full hookups, with DirecTV & wifi. Coin op. washer & dryer. Our site is next to the road, but not a lot of traffic. Turn from road is a bit tight but we made it with 28 ft trailer. Would not recommend it for large rigs, and nothing for kids to do here. We were pleased with our week long stay.
This is our second time staying here. It is so peaceful and relaxing. The owners are awesome. Located near alot great places to visit and eat. Hoping to make this an annual visit.

My husband and I stayed in the cabin for a few nights and really enjoyed our stay. The cabin is pretty small but it is perfect for just two people. It was very clean and the sheets ad linens were all spotless too. Maxine was there to greet us and she was wonderfully helpful and friendly. Unlike a lot of other  cabins in the area she doesn't tack a big "cleaning fee" onto the cost of your stay. One thing people should be aware of is that the bed is very small. Its wonderfully comfortable but small. My husband and I are both average weight and so the size didn't bother us at all but had we been much bigger it could have made for some uncomfortable nights. 
The only down side was that there is not a door on the front porch. It is screened in but there is no screen door to stop the bugs coming in. I wanted to have the cabin door open for more fresh air while I was cooking but couldn't do so without letting the bugs in. It also would have been nice to sit on the porch in the evening but I seem to attract every mosquito within a 20 miles radius so I was unable to enjoy the porch.

Nice folks, clean facility.  This is a good location for many attractions without long winding mountain roads to travel getting to them or back.  Enjoyed my stay.  A sliding bolt or deadlock would be nice for the back door!

name: Creeper Trail Campground Inc
location: 2248 Whitetop Gap Rd, Whitetop, VA 24292, USA
comments: I must say this campground has gone downhill quite a bit in my opinion.  Recently stayed there with a group.  Horse manure everywhere in group camping area and parking lot.  Never opened store.  Stage area at end of group campground is dangerous and in dire need of repair including roof.  Dog barking constantly at night.  Someone riding motorcycle though camp well past what should have been quiet hours.  Horses whinny right next to camping area at night.  Way overpriced for the condition it is in.  A real shame because the location is excellent.  I hope the family can get it in better shape.  We have stayed here quite a bit and this is the worst I've experienced.

BE AWARE - IN DISREPAIR

We booked this campground based on earlier reviews. We arrived and learned the campground has changed ownership and has gone downhill. The site we booked was supposed to be a full hookup for an RV. The site did not have sewer and was on a 2-ft slope inappropriate for an RV. To reach the site, we had to drive a rutted pot-holed steep dirt road. 

Also, we had tent campers with us who needed bath facilities. The bathhouse is about 1/3 of a mile down the steep dirt road. We left. 

With improvements, this could be an ideal campground for folks wanting to ride the Creeper Trail.
Disappointed in this campground.  They closed down during the month of May and did not tell our Cub Scout Pack that they were closed.

Simple campground. We went there with a 40ft RV said we'd have no problems....driveway was a dirt road uphill going in & it had rained. I recommend staying here in a tent or small class c not a 40ft rv. Did have some full hookup sites. No debit machine or office for last min supplies so be prepared. Have cash!! The ride up to it is a nail biter!!!! The good part is...it's right at the creeper trail that goes all down hill into the next town. Had a blast but won't take our RV there again...
I camp here every year with a group. It's an excellent place for bicycle camping, convenient to the VA Creeper Trail.

name: Cardens Bluff Campground
comments: Im being a little harsh here.  The location and pitches and the views are all spectacular.  However the bathrooms and showers on site were a joke.  There was one bathroom with toilets near the pitch and the gents had the door wedged open facing the road.  Problem was that the urinal was covered with a plastic bag and the door was missing from the cubical.  Next block from the pitch was closed permanently.  So the only usable bathrooms for men were the showers, which are a wet room with shower and w/c.  There were 4 doors but 2 were always engaged, i.e.  out of service, leaving 2 for the whole site. If two people wanted a  shower there were no toilets...  They were mouldy and damp and a puddle formed in front of the toilet when you had a shower.  Could be a great site if the facilities were only maintained.

This campground was very low-key and offered the mind and soul to relax. We were very fortunate to reserve a campsite with direct lake access and views from inside our tent. The bathrooms are relatively close to the campsites and the bathhouses are pretty clean. Overall, the campground is well maintained and a peaceful place. I will definitely return!!
My husband and I love this place. We will definitely be back. Very peaceful, quiet and clean!!

Bunu söylememin sebebi de şu; Kamp alanına girdiğinizde göl etrafında yakın aralıklar ile ''Yüzmek Yasaktır'' tabelaları bulunmakta ve üzerilerinde yeterli açıklama bulunmamakta. Bizde tamamen yasak olduğunu düşünerek girmedik. Fakat ve ancak çıkışta karşılaştığımız bir görevli ile konuştuğumuzda yasağın sadece yüzmeyi bilmeyenler için geçerli olduğunu öğrendik. Doğal olarak hem tatlı su hemde oranın özelliğinden olduğunu öğrendiğimize göre hemen hemen hiç kaldırma kuvveti yokmuş suyun... Kesinlikle görülmesi gerek diye düşünüyorum.....

name: Cottonwood Park
location: 1717 Alaska Hwy, Destruction Bay, YT Y0B 1H0, Canada
comments:
Beautiful park but the owner is a bit overzealous with rules.  He got a little nasty with our neighbor right in front of us for drying their clothes on a line but also will not allow campers to use laundry facilities so it's kind of  a catch-22 when you are in the middle of nowhere.  We had no problems but seeing how he handled the neighbor really left a bad taste in my mouth.  We ended up meeting the neighbors again several weeks later by chance and you couldn't find a more courteous and respectful couple.  Otherwise, you couldn't ask for a nicer location.  

Owner had to have septic tank pumped out for whatever reason and it was done at 11:00 at night, still daylight.  Wind blew smell across entire campground.  Unfortunate, but he had to do it sometime and probably at Mercy of septic truck company schedule.   

I would stay there again for sure in hopes Owner was having a bad day or reads this review and works on his people skills.  The location is fabulous and the maintenance of campground is 2nd to none.

Only 15A hookup for US$40, odd maneuvering your RV for water filling the only water supply, inclined dump station near restroom, weak WIFI, pack your own garbage out... If you can put up with these, then the campground have great free DVDs, beautifully landscaped, some sites with tent pads and even wooden deck to stretch out, hot clean shower/toilet. Linda at Cottonwood advised us to watch for bear and her cubs provided that Glen doing his job chasing them away. We told them if no peaceful coexistence then we'll lean toward self preservation and will spray them if they endangering our cubs. Linda relented but look at us strangely! Low rating due to treatment of none resident campers, hundred miles out of nowhere, and would not provide sanidump for a price but to turn them away.
Very nice campground / RV park on the shores of a picturesque lake. What few people know is they also have a couple hand built cabins for rent that are the envy of the Yukon.
Cute park, friendly people. Laundry is currently closed.  One bathhouse. Very cute mini golf and horse shoe pits, plus the awesome lake.

Fantastic RV and Camp site on Kluane. Well maintained and adequate services for RV'ers and Tent Capers alike. Glen and Linda are good hosts and respond to any concerns with great hospitality. Keep your wits about you for bears if tenting but Glen does a good job of keeping them off the property as best as he can.

name: Tsodilo Camp
comments: Fantastic Kalahari bush experience where you will be surrounded by silence!

This location on GMaps is only the entrance to the campsite, this is where you pay for your stay. You have to drive more to the north-east to reach the various spots where you can actually camp. They are really scattered, you will have plenty of privacy. Ablution blocks sometimes without water because the animals open the taps and empty the tanks. Even further, at the foot of the hills, in front of the small museum, there is another campsite. There was water in this one, yeah! We only had a 2x4 car so it was quite exhausting to get there, a lot of sand or sharp rocks or deep gouges and NO signs to guide you into the maze of tracks. But I made it and would do it again because the walk in the hills was really interesting, with a very knowledgeable guide and the view from the top is great. I guess with a fully equipped 4x4 camping jeep it must really be a piece of cake.

name: Parque de Campismo de Belinho
comments: 10 min walking to the beach, quiet camping, no toilet seats

Os funcionários são outros e tornaram o meu fim de semana num pesadelo. Entrei às 17h para acampar, e as 21h a suposta presidente (porque não se identificou) veio junto à nossa tenda dizer que não podíamos estar ali... Como eu lhe respondi que não faria sentido desmontar a tenda passados 4 horas de ter entrado e porque já estava escuro, ela iniciou um discurso muito desrespeitador e começou a insultar me de uma maneira como nunca antes tinha visto. De seguida foi chamar o marido em que este se comportou ainda pior. Queriam que eu fosse embora porque já tinha pago. Disseram me aos gritos que não devolviam dinheiro nenhum. 
Todos os anos venho até este parque e nunca tive problemas. Agora com estes indivíduos a gerir o parque, não lá voltarei nunca mais!

Campeggio tutto su erba e quindi molto comodo per la tenda.Bagni molto curati, puliti e profumati.Dal campeggio,5 minuti a piedi e si arriva all'oceano. Unica nota dolente è la quantità incredibile di mosche che al mattino infestano la zona.Spariscono poi verso tardo pomeriggio. Comunque consigliatissimo.

Bastante sossegado, pessoas muito prestáveis e espectaculares. Um contra não tem grande ponto de diversão para as crianças ao k obriga a sair do parque até Esposende ou Viana do Castelo e a causa de ter ao redor campos hortícolas tem muitas moscas o k s torna chato mas fora isso é um parque fixe

Bel campeggio a due passi dalla spiaggia di sassi, che visto il vento è meglio, riparato, toilette pulite, indicato più per autocaravan che per tende. Unica nota dolente che andrebbe aggiornata è che per gli stranieri non c'è la possibilità di pagare con la carta di credito o bancomat..
